description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9jabh","text":"Phenocycler-Fusion assay enables multiplexed antibody based imaging of FFPE or fresh frozen tissues. Hematoxylin and Eosin (H\u0026E) staining is a gold standard method for observing tissue morphology. Obtaining multiplexed protein expression information and H\u0026E images from the same tissue provides an additional layer of valuable information which can be used to interpret imaging data and used as input novel machine learning algorithms. This protocol details the steps to generate high quality H\u0026E images from both FFPE and fresh frozen (FF) tissues following multiplexed imaging on the Phenocycler-Fusion. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7m62","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"80f8o","text":"This protocol can also be used for H\u0026E staining following multiplexed imaging on other platforms. In that case, skip the 'Flow cell removal' section, perform two washes of    each in 1X PBS and proceed directly to Step 5.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":174},{"style":"italic","offset":175,"length":46},{"style":"bold","offset":214,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":173,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3kuu1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"mins","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"do372","text":"To mount the slides, remove slides one at a time on to a paper towel inside the fume hood. Leave the other slides in the last xylene/Histo-Clear coplin jar to prevent over-drying the tissue.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ov70","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2soop","text":"Dry the back of the slide and tilt to remove excess xylene, but do not let the tissues dry. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2esio","text":"Clean a glass coverslip quickly and remove any particles on its surface. Place the long edge of the coverslip on the edge of the slide closest to you, tip the slide towards yourself so the mountant begins to reach the coverslip, and gently push down until the mounting media has spread evenly across the slide area containing tissue. {"blocks":[{"key":"56bnm","text":"After a successful Phenocycler run, slides with attached flow cells can be stored in the storage buffer at   or used immediately for H\u0026E staining.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":107,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"923q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}
